text: HRdty 7ek TTTHf xifetarrut &H9 / Phone 91-11-25074100/25074200 (ss 4Rar 3) {TTHNf AATTT4) G4 / 91-11-25093507 25093514 National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways) 6f-5 & 6, 74zr-10, ERoT, T feit-110075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka; New Delhi-110075 NHAI/Policy Guidelines/PF Toll Plaza/2021 Policy Circular No.17.5.80/2021, Dated O6th April, 2021 (Decision taken on e-File Comp No. 50225) Sub: Atmanirbhar Bharat: Relief for  Contractors/developers of Road Sector- Direction for implementation of relief to User Fee Collection Contractors on Public Funded Projects- Relief in interest rate for payment of remittance. In continuation to NHAI Poli No. 17.5.79 dated 28th 2020 followed by office orders issued from time to time in this regard and in accordance with decision of 462nd Executive Committee (EC) meeting held on March, 2021, (Agenda Item No_ 462.12) with respect to representation received from All India User Fee Contractors Federation (AIUCF), interest rate as given below shall be charged / payable on delayed remittance for the contracts executed to COVID-19 and continued during COVID-19 period for Force Majeure Claims only. Interest @12% per annum shall be charged on the shortfall in estimated remittance deposited by the contractors from due date till seventh post communication of estimated remittance by ROs/PIUs to the user fee collecting agencies. Interest rate as per clause 19 shall be   applicable thereafter on delayed deposition of estimated remittance. Illustration is at Annexure-A. 2 The ROs/PIUs may settle the Force Majeure Claims of COVID period after considering above relief approved by EC. This dispensation is not applicable to other Force Majeure claims and will cease after the closure of Force Majeure settlements of COVID-19 pandemic period. 3_ This issues with the approval of Competent Authority.
